intro: Mesomelaena tetragona, commonly known as the four-angled mesomelaena, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, particularly Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its square-shaped stems and small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are ovate with a rough texture and often have a slight pubescence. Mesomelaena tetragona is typically found in tropical rainforests and thrives in humid, shaded environments.
